CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 6, 1953, pg. 36 reads: Herron Hill's Research Project - The pupils who publish the Beacon newspaper, at Herron Hill Junior High School have just completed a citizenship project as part of their regular school work. The pupils collected over two thousand items of free educational materials.   These include maps, pamphlets and exhibits.  Their purpose was to serve the school before they are graduated.  This entire project is part of a multi-million-dollar Columbia University Citizenship Education Project.  In Pittsburgh this program is sponsored by the Pittsburgh Board of Public Education and is under the direction of C.H. W.Pullen, director of secondary education.  Shown examining the large amount of material which students obtained are, left to right, Leroy Titus, Claudia Allen, Audrey Burden, Isaiah Polk, Vera Thompson, Jacqueline Holyfield, Ronald McGee, Priscilla Ward, William Harris, Kenneth Darby and Allan Goodman on the stage.  Below the stage: James Tyler, Delores Gary, Hannah Matthews, Josephine Glass, C.L. Laughner, Marlene Davis, Barbara McCollum, Romaine Parham and Clarence Rockamore. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Students and teachers, on stage from left: Leroy Titus, Claudia Allen, Audrey Burden, Isaiah Polk, Vera Thompson (Matthews), Jacqueline Holyfield, Ronald McGee, Priscilla Ward, William Harris, Kenneth Darby, and Allan Goodman; below stage: James Tyler, Delores Gary, Hannah Matthews, Josephine Glass, C. L. Laughner, Marlene Davis, Barbara McCollum, Romaine Parham, and Clarence Rockamore, gathered in auditorium looking over collected educational materials including maps and books, Herron Hill Junior High School
